Entries.default:
You find a woman of early middle years dressed fine - if dirty - armor adorned with bright purple piping. A pair of long scars bisect her brow and jaw.

Though she stands at ease, a nervous energy thrums through her.
"Fair day, traveler!" She grins broadly, a joyful twinkle lighting her eyes.
"Hello there!"
"Good day!"
"Keeping up with your reading, I trust?"
"Anything I can do for you, just say the word!"
"Tell me about yourself."
"Lady adventurer, at your humble service. I was born in Aedyr and raised in the field, and there's nary a crevice of this archipelago I haven't seen!"
"Could you teach me what you learned in your time exploring the Livings Lands?"
"If you'd like to learn more, you'll have to buy a copy of my monograph!" She winks.
"With pleasure! Teaching is my specialty, after all. I'm going to pack your brain with so much knowledge, you're going to have a headache for a week. "All I need from you is three thousand copper."

She starts first with the practical training - how to move silently through bush, when and how best to hide, how to step so as to muffle the sounds of your feet.

Satisfied, she moves on to a high level explanation of various theories of knowledge. She seems to have quite a passion for epistemology, and goes on for an excruciatingly long time before at last sending you on your way.
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Travel quick, travel quiet!" She gives you a friendly punch on the shoulder and turns away.
"The field?"
[Listen.]
"Aye, the Living Lands most oft, but the Deadfire as well of late."
"Being a cipher's come in quite handy, I'll tell you that."
"I split my time between Aedyr and the Living Lands, though I've spent much time in the Deadfire of late."
"And, my goodness, if you think the Deadfire's wild, I must say, it's no more thrilling than a lady of luxury's afternoon luncheon in comparison to the glorious madness of the Living Lands."
"And, my goodness, if you think the Deadfire's wild, I must say, it's no more thrilling than a lady of luxury's afternoon luncheon in comparison to the glorious madness of the Living Lands."
"Do you often get into trouble, then?"
[Listen.]
"Trouble seems to find me wherever I go! Not a lick of it's my fault, of course - it's the university, always sending me to the most dangerous corners of Eora, the scamps."
"If I didn't know better, I might say they were trying to kill me! There's naught other way to rid themselves of a tenured professor, after all." She laughs.
"Oh dear me, yes! Can't seem to avoid it. Not a lick of it's my fault, of course - it's the university, always sending me to the most dangerous corners of Eora, the scamps."
"If I didn't know better, I might say they were trying to kill me! There's naught other way to rid themselves of a tenured professor, after all." She laughs.
"Get any good stories out of it, at least?"
[Listen.]

"Oh, aye, aye - some you wouldn't right believe! Like the time I lost a part of my ear here, see?" She pulls back her hair and shows you her mangled ear. It looks like something's had a good chew on it.

"Lost an entire research team along with the ear! Rather a long day, that was.

"My colleagues have implied I might be cursed, but I can't say I much agree."
"It's just the nature of the work, you understand? I mean, goodness, if you want a lady to find you the rarest plants, you've got to send her to the most remote places!"

"On my last expedition, my colleague Ines got herself lost looking for what was essentially a big, prickly weed. No medicinal use at all! "I found her, though. Mostly intact, even. A blessing from the Living Lands, I call it, aye."
"But I do go on, don't I?" She laughs gaily, a hand splayed across her chest.
"No, I don't think so."
"Excellent! Let's get down to business, shall we?"
She nods. "That's your prerogative, I suppose. Come back if you change your mind!"
[Enhance Stealth and Metaphysics] "Here you are."
